titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bland family papers, 1879-1890
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters written to and from members of the Bland family, mostly between siblings. Edward Bland studied at Hampden-Sydney College in the 1870's, and later taught school in Smith's Grove, Warren Co., Ky., where he also sold insurance. His sister Emma was a student at Clarksville Seminary in Tenn. and later taught school in Wellville and McFarland, Va. Includes some letters to William Bland regarding his legal practice.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Bland family Papers, 1879-1890, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Family in Wellville, Nottoway Co., Va.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters written to and from members of the Bland family, mostly between siblings. Edward Bland studied at Hampden-Sydney College in the 1870's, and later taught school in Smith's Grove, Warren Co., Ky., where he also sold insurance. His sister Emma was a student at Clarksville Seminary in Tenn. and later taught school in Wellville and McFarland, Va. Includes some letters to William Bland regarding his legal practice.
